page.title: 01Description of SW Fairford
page.content: In the north-east corner of the area is the west part of Fairford.From here {uplands}extend westwards to Meysey Hampton.North and south of this is flatter and lower land. In the south of the area is Fairford Airfield. Most of the fields are planted with {crops,}the rest are left for pasture. There are a few clumps of trees in this area,but generally the trees are mature are isolated.Between the fields are narrow country lanes,lined with hedges,from which grow many trees. The River Coln flows north-south through Fairford before joining the Thames.As{communications through this {area run east-west}the River Coln has not been made a feature in the same way as in neighbouring Bibury.
